com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api

Class ConnectorException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.ConnectorException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class ConnectorException
extends RuntimeException
    ConnectorException is an exception that a connector throws to stop a job that is running or to end a design-time operation with a specified message.
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectorException

        public ConnectorException(String message)
        Constructs a new exception with the specified message.
        Parameters:
        message - The detailed message.

      • ConnectorException

        public ConnectorException(Integer messageNumber,
                  String message)
        Constructs a new exception with the specified message. The message ID is constructed from the message number that is specified and the component ID that is set by calling Logger.setComponentID(String) method. If the component ID is set to Logger.COMPONENT_ID_DEFAULT or if the value that is specified for the messageNumber is negative or greater than Logger.MAX_CUSTOM_MESSAGE_NUMBER, then the message ID for the Logger.fatal(String) method is used.
        Parameters:
        messageNumber - The message number to log.
        message - The detailed message.

    • Method Detail

      • getMessageNumber

        Gets a message number.
        Returns:
        A message number
